Subject: How to enable/disable JUnit tests programatically ?

I am using JUnit 4.6 with ANT. I would like to filter out some tests at run=
time if the running machine is not online. And to avoid, tight coupling I w=
ould like to avoid to hardcode in the ANT file which tests to enable/disabl=
e.

Ideally I would like to define a custom attribute to my tests such as @=
RequireOnline and configure all the Junit runners (incl Parameterized) to f=
ilter out these tests based on my custom meta data on the test and the onli=
ne/offline-state calculated at runtime.

Is something like this possible?

=
Thanks,
Morten
